channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12931] The existing KeyValues in memstore are not removed completely after inserting cell into memStore
item.description:
If I'm not wrong, the UPSERT method of memStore should remove all existing KeyValues except the newer version.

In memStore,

DefaultMemStore.java

int versIionsVisible = 0;

...

if (cur.getTypeByte() == KeyValue.Type.Put.getCode() &&

            cur.getSequenceId() <= readpoint) {

          if (versionsVisible > 1) {

            // if we get here we have seen at least one version visible to the oldest scanner,

            // which means we can prove that no scanner will see this version



            // false means there was a change, so give us the size.

            long delta = heapSizeChange(cur, true);

            addedSize -= delta;

            this.size.addAndGet(-delta);

            it.remove();

            setOldestEditTimeToNow();

          } else {

            versionsVisible++;

          }

Does "versionsVisible > 1" should be changed to "versionsVisible >= 1" ?
thanks.
item.summary: The existing KeyValues in memstore are not removed completely after inserting cell into memStore

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I think it is the correct the way it is. We can remove all KVs after we have proven that the oldest scanner has seen at least one version. I.e. that scanner has to be able to see one version (versionsVisible == 1) and the following KVs can be removed (versionVisible > 1).

hi Lars Hofhansl. Thank you for providing the requested information. I am a bit confused about the "versionsVisible".
I think the current relation between version and versionsVisible are as follows:

one version → versionsVisible == 0

two version → versionsVisible == 1

the others → versionsVisible > 1

Sorry if I made any mistake

It's possible I made a mistake in HBASE-4583 and there's an off-by-one error.
Can change it and see whether all tests still pass.
This is only used in Increments and Appends.

hi Lars Hofhansl. The test for UPSERT of DefaultMemStore is as follows：

Bar.java

    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();

    memstore = new DefaultMemStore(conf, KeyValue.COMPARATOR);

    

    List<Cell> l = new ArrayList<Cell>();

    KeyValue kv1 = KeyValueTestUtil.create("r", "f", "q", 100, "v");

    KeyValue kv2 = KeyValueTestUtil.create("r", "f", "q", 101, "v");



    kv1.setSequenceId(1); kv2.setSequenceId(1);

    l.add(kv1); l.add(kv2);

    memstore.upsert(l, 2);

    assert(memstore.cellSet.size() == 1);

The error is occurred in the assert. I think that the size of cellSet should be 1. Did I say it right? thanks

Sorry for my improper test. Now it's amended as following:

Bar.java

    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();

    memstore = new DefaultMemStore(conf, KeyValue.COMPARATOR);

    

    List<Cell> l = new ArrayList<Cell>();

    KeyValue kv1 = KeyValueTestUtil.create("r", "f", "q", 100, "v");

    KeyValue kv2 = KeyValueTestUtil.create("r", "f", "q", 101, "v");

    KeyValue kv3 = KeyValueTestUtil.create("r", "f", "q", 102, "v");



    kv1.setSequenceId(1); kv2.setSequenceId(1);kv3.setSequenceId(3);

    l.add(kv1); l.add(kv2); l.add(kv3);

    

    memstore.upsert(l, 2);

    assert(memstore.cellSet.size() == 2);

The scenario is the kv2 should be seen by scanner and the kv1 should be removed. (the max version for this CF is 1)
So I think that the size of cellSet should be 2. Did I say it right? Thanks again.
